title: Mapúa MCL ACM website
description: An organizational website for the Mapúa MCL ACM Student Chapter to introduce the organization and post events. Created this project with 2 other people.

title: Seat Save
description: A seat reservation system for our school’s library to help observe COVID-19 safety protocols. Made with 3 other people as a Software Engineering 2 course project. I led the UI/UX and front-end development for the system’s website.

title: Sparse
description: A system that utilizes computer vision in monitoring the room occupancy of our school’s library. Created with 3 other people as a Software Engineering 1 course project.

title: Treasure Hunt Mobile
description: A 2D game where the player collects all the treasure boxes as fast as possible. Created as a project for my Game Design and Development course.

title: Portfolio website
description: A portfolio website to showcase my projects.

title: Pokedex
description: A simple catalog website to view Pokémon data using PokéAPI.

title: Nebula Token
description: A Solidity smart contract that creates my own ERC20 token. It has a front-end to allow users to perform functions, but I didn’t give much focus on it. This is a project I made for the Metacrafters ETH PROOF: Intermediate EVM Course. It was also required for me to give a code walkthrough.

title: Add to Cart dApp
description: A Solidity smart contract that has an add-to-cart functionality. It has a front-end to allow users to perform functions, but I didn’t give much focus on it. This is a project I made for the Metacrafters ETH PROOF: Intermediate EVM Course. It was also required for me to give a code walkthrough.

title: Hair Day website
description: A website homepage for a fictional company called “Hair Day”. The final project I submitted for the Meta HTML and CSS in depth course in Coursera.

title: Mantras
description: A random app I made that picks the “Manifesting Mantras of the Day” from a set of mantras.

title: Snake Game
description: A very simple snake game that I created to learn Python while following a tutorial online.
